QUALIFICATIONS

Life, Business Coach  Animas Centre of Coaching, London , UK 
 
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
March 2016 to date Evonik Dubai  
Position: Head of HR , MEA Region, HR Business Part ner EMEA  
Head Quartered in Germany, Evonik is a specialty chemicals producer with 2017 
global sales of €14 billion  
Strategically directed the  HR function s across nine regional offices in UAE, Iran, Egypt, 
Jordan, Saud i Arabia, Morocco, Kenya, Ghana, Russia, Turkey, Switzerland, and SA 
with 500+ employees and a staff budget of 50M Euros . 
Manage and develop personnel  by executing  HRM strategies as well as coordinating 
HRM practices and processes.  Integrate  Sub-Saharan region’s HR function into MEA.  
Streamline HR activities through internal approval processes and recruitment tools . 
Conduct annual performance and salary process  reviews,  salary and annual bonus 
calculations , employee coaching, m entoring,  counselling and conflict mediation . 
Create  training and development  plans for empl oyees in accordance with relevant 
business line.  Analyse  labour codes/legislation in the countries i n which the businesses 
operate.  
 
Key Contributions:  
• Strategic HR Counselling for EMEA region as well as alignment of platforms.  
• Supports the President of the Region EMEA/Cluster MEA and his management 
team in Str ategic HR   Counselling and Strategic input on HR topics  
• Represents the HR function of the region in business -driven projects (e.g. M&A 
projects).  
• Spearheaded the development , and execution  of a compensation and benefits 
structure covering  Succession Planning, Talents Management, Performance 
Management, Strategic Workforce Planning, Change Management,  HR 
Communication, J ob Grading, and Salary Bands alignment across the region.  
    
• Developed recruitment tool and upgraded regional hiring procedu res and 
employee transfer processes  by minimising the cycle time to hire into a new 
position.  
• Headed successful recruitment drives; s upervise d staff on all matters 
associated with HR administration, HR data maintenance using success factor , 
(SAP -P63), Workday and employment contract management.  
 
2012 to 2016 Nobel Oil – Baku Azerbaijan  
Nobel Oil is a privately owned company operating in the Azerbaijan upstream and 
downstream Oil & Gas sector.  
 
August 2015 to March 2016  
Position: Dir ector,  Corporate Human Resources  
 
Augu st 2012 t o August 2015  
Position: Head of Human Resources Department  
Grew  the number of employees to 1200  while managing the HR annual budget of 
$6.2M. Steered all HRM a spects in the corporate offices of seven businesses . 
Guided diverse range of businesses on the development of their spe cific HR strategies, 
objectives, and KPI’ s. Stewarded HR functions in the due d iligence processes of 
acquiring SDL Fabrication Company , setting up of a JV with Wood Group for off shore 
brownfield e ngineering, and supporting company tenders on BP’s fabrication and valve 
maintenance projects. Revised medi cal insurance packages for the g roup’s employees 
and ESS programmes.  Analysed labour codes/legislation in the countries i n which the 
businesses opera te. 
 
Key Contributions:  
• Directed and controlled the development and execution of company’s corporate 
level human resources policies, pro cedures, strategies, objectives, and KPI’s.  
• Enriched organisational productivity by endorsing the sharing of HR best 
practices and lessons  learned across the g roup’s  businesses and within 
relevant departments.  
• Recognised as “HR Manager of the Year 2015” in Azerbaijan by “The P World” 
International C ompany  due to le
